reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the second time I have visited Adina Hauptbahnhof - and when next I visit Berlin (probably sooner rather than later), I will stay here. The room is spacious with a kitchenette and huge fridge, the pool and gym areas are large and well furnished, the breakfast is perfect (not too much or little with amazing waiting staff) and the location is quite central, a pleasant walking distance to the Berliner Tor, Checkpoint Charlie, the French Quarter and the funky Rosa-Luxembourg-Platz and Shoenhouser Allee.
reviews.title: Spacious, Well Located and Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I highly recommend for singles, couples and families.
reviews.title: Soooo pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really pleased with our five nights at the hotel! The kids loved the pool, which is good sized for a mid-town hotel and easy accessible beside the lobby, there is a good sauna and a great little fitness room there too.
reviews.title: Very comofortable and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in a 1-bedroom apartment in the Adina near the main train station. It was billed as a 4 star establishment and I thought it lived up to its billing.
reviews.title: Adina Hauptbahnhof Berlin A Good Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For the price we had more than adquate space and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant associated with the hotel was OK - no problem there.
reviews.title: Great place for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk staff was efficient and professional. All of them spoke fluent English, which took the strain off of my German.
reviews.title: Nice room, poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at the Adina and it was Wonderful. I have stayed in similar Apartment in London - but at double the price! . It's in a quiet corner of Mitte and is very well located: it’s a five-minute walk from the Hauptbanhof (main train station which has the regional and international lines) and the closest U-bahn station is a ten-minute walk. It’s a five-minute train ride to most sights in Berlin.
reviews.title: Wonderful Faultless Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is pretty new and quite classy with pool and gym facilities, a funky bar/restaurant and rooms with very modern interior design. Because it’s an “apartment hotel”, you get facilities that you normally wouldn’t get in a standard room – washing machine and dryer, kitchenette with all you need to make breakfast & snacks, one bedroom with television and a lounge room. We got a fantastic web rate so it was great value for money.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was efficient and friendly - the rooms outstandingly clean and comfortable with lovely toiletries in the bathroom which included luxury body lotion. It was a pleasure to come back to the room/apartment after a days sight seeing.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a supermarket where you can buy toiletries/breakfast essentiasl etc about a 10 minute walk, think it was an Aldi. All in all, a wonderful City with lots to see and a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Well worth the ratings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Adina in east Berlin for three nights. What a wonderful hotel. About a 20 min walk to the Brandenburg gate and the museums, a 15 minute walk to many places to eat, and 10 min to the best Berlin wall site. The morning breakfast was outstanding with a wonderful variety. The staff was also outstanding. The only issue I would recommend is when you make a reservation and you want a suit if you have more than two people, make sure you state you want the suite. This is just different than the way we have made reservations in the States. It all worked out. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Modern Aparthotel, Central Location, Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Originally booked for one night only, but decided to come back for another 2 night stay. Fabulous hotel! My friend and I shared a twin room on the 7th floor on the first night and for the remaining 2 nights were given a room on floor 2. The original bedroom had twin beds separated by a wall holding the tv with no doors to the living room. However, the 2nd floor room was better. This had a separate bedroom and had a washing machine and tumble drier in the bathroom. For us, it was worth the extra. The location is perfect. Opposite is the Natural History museum (well worth a visit), and minutes from the Underground to the right, or the Hautbahnof train station to the left. This is a fabulous place considering you're there to catch trains. Plenty of shopping and very helpful staff. Can't fault the hotel. What problems there were, were niggly ones, missing corkscrew, flat batteries in remote, having to ask for slippers for the pool and dressing gowns which were in the pool area. I would have preferred to go to the pool in the gown and slippers, but that's a minor point. The kitchen was well equipped, although I didn't like all the clutter in the fridge of the minibar stuff which was prohibitively expensive. Who makes up these prices?! Shopping can be bought from LIDL 7 minutes walk down the road (not open Sundays) but open until 8pm. There's also Kaiser's supermarket at the Hautbahnhof. Washing powder sachets can be bought from the hotel. The rooms were very warm indeed, and the quilts very heavyweight. I ended up taking the quilt out and just using the cover and a blanket,although I'm sure the staff would have given me a sheet if I'd asked. Lovely staff, nothing too much trouble. Kindly let us drop our bags in store after we checked out so we could sightsee. The seating area in the lobby is perfect to unwind before travelling, gorgeous fire and interesting books. Swimming pool and sauna are lovely. Lots of towels, dressing gowns and freebie perfume samples, and open until 11pm. Didn't eat at the hotel, but the corner coffee house does excellent soup, cakes and coffee at very reasonable prices. Will definitely come back here. Adored Berlin as a City, and this hotel sums up the spirit of the place, good value for money and wonderful people. Don't hesitate to book!
reviews.title: Choose this fabulous hotel for your Berlin stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in October. We decided to stay here because we have a young baby and wanted a larger room and kitchenette to prepare our babies home cooked food. We were very disappointed on arrival to be told that the cot would cost us an extra €10 per night, after complaining that I was spending over €1000 at the hotel for 2 rooms they eventually waivered the fee. When asked why they charged extra for the cot they informed me it was for changing the sheets, well the sheets were not changed once during the 6 night stay - maybe they waivered this service in line with the charge! We were also disappointed to receive a room without a bath, obviously we had a baby yet this was not factored into the booking. The reception staff said that we could borrow a baby bath, but when we requested this they said someone had it and we couldn't have it until the following day, which was very disappointing. Furthermore the kitchenette is very poorly equipped. Expedia described the rooms as having full kitchenette; both our room and my parents did not have any hobs, only a combination oven/microwave. So the idea of steaming my childs food on the steamer which I bought with me went out of the window, I do 90% of my cooking at home on the hob and would describe this as an essential component of a kitchen, so again very disappointing.
reviews.title: Not child friendly and poor kitchenette

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: In summary do not book this hotel if you want a bath, a kitchenette or a room suitable for a baby.
reviews.title: Perfect choice for family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand if I stayed in the hotel just with my wife I wouldn't have had such complaints so it really depends on your circumstances. The rooms are large, modern and clean. The pool area is lovely, and the hotel also has a small gym and sauna. We didn't eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on that.
reviews.title: Great apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of location it is on a quiet street 10 minutes walk from both the Hauptbahnhof and the nearest U-bahn station. It is also about 10 minutes from Friedrichstrasse and dozens of shops, restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities
Great start to the holiday
reviews.text: It only takes about ten minutes to walk here from the train station. The rooms are immaculate. Clean and fully equipped for a very comfortable few days in Berlin. Yes it is a little walk into the centre of Berlin but really not a problem. The restaurant and staff were top notch and we ate here twice. Don't be tempted by the Italian opposite the hotel. We will definitely look out for Adina Apartments in the future.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were on a rail trip & wanted a hotel near the station. We booked the Adina & wow, what a great decision. Beautiful. Large rooms with all mod cons & beautifully presented. Lovely staff, so happy & very smiley. Nice bar & restaurant. We ate there twice as it was just great. Wonderful. We would definitely go there again. Aussie wine too!
reviews.title: Convenience with Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed five nights with our two kids in July. Excellent choice for us but for one minor issue. A kitchen and washer and dryer were nice amenities to have. My kids used the pool nightly. The fitness center had everything anyone needed to get good workout. Location also was very good. Easy to navigate from the hotel to major sites and/or the mass transit system which is excellent. Bakery at the corner of the street was excellent. Finally, I read many of the reviews concerning the internet. I didn't find it expensive because the charge was not continuous. We purchased 720 minutes for approximately 7.5 euros and the key is that as long as you're sign off, the charges cease; so, we had internet for the entire time. As indicated in other reviews, the hotel is very quiet and spotless.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have given it an excellent rating but for there were extra charges for our kids when we booked the hotel through Hotels.com, which I believed would provide us, at a minimum, an extra bed. However, there was no extra bed or space; rather, a sofa bed appeared to be the reason for the extra charge. Other than this minor issue since our rate was still reasonable, the hotel comes highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay and Good Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here with my partner for 8 nights in a one bedroom suite.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities, modern design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Adina hotel is new, clean, fully equipped, and tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: It truly deserves its excellent rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The apartments are spacious, with a bedroom and a separate lounge area. They have kitchenette, fridge, washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, toaster, and two flats tvs.
reviews.title: A bit away from the sights but great for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a small but nice gym, swimming pool and sauna. Everything brand and new. And they are opened from 6 am to 11 pm.
reviews.title: Top Marks for the Adina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Yet, is not a massive hotel, it looks more like a “hotel boutique”.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast maybe not huge but offers a wide range of products of excellent quality.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel to a warm welcome from the receptionist; He offered lots of maps and tips for the surrounding areas. The room was a studio apartment which meant it was spacious but had everything you needed down to a good quality iron and hairdryer. The finish on all of the furniture was really good; sleek and contemporary yet the room was comfortable. There was plenty of leaflets and information about Berlin in the room which were also helpful. The shower was powerful and huge!!! The bed was really comfy to the extent that we slept in both days. We therefore didnt eat breakfast in the hotel but the menu looked nice and was reasonably priced. There are plenty of places to eat in the surrounding areas anyway - Barista is well worth a visit - under the arches next to the hotel. The hotel location was really good; very central and next to a bustling market area with plenty of bars and restuarants; you could get a taxi outside the door no problem and the tram was right beside you. All in all would highly recommend this hotel and we will most definitely be back - excellent value!
reviews.title: Well worth a visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 night stay with my girlfriend. Very easy to find from Hauptbahnhof. Pretty much midway between mainline / underground and suburban railway stations so a 10 - 15minute walk is required if you want a train. Otherwise excellent location. Safe, clean close to numerous shops and cafes (excellent choices - the breakfast in the hotel is very expensive).
reviews.title: Rooms bigger than they look in the pictures, excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in staff friendly and courteous, lovely smart lobby. Room absolutle highlight. Large kitchen / sitting area with dinner table. Kitchen very well kitted out. We were on the 6th floor, and balcony had views (in the distance!) of Reichstag and TV tower. Bedroom separate, again spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: An excellent base for exploring Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Swimming pool relatively big, clean - noone seemed to be using it so had it to myself! Sauna large and excellent to warm up after being out in the cold. The only thing lacking is a jacuzzi - excellent spot for one next to the pool - can you not put one in?!
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall very impressive, good value for money (approx. £80 per night for double), high standard of accomodation, excellent location. And Berlin is totally awesome!
reviews.title: Great base for Berlin city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, very clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. We had a room on the 7th ( top ) floor and had good views over the city from our mini balcony. Breakfast was first class, plenty of choice and hot dishes regularly replenished by the chef and prepared for a full day of sightseeing on foot. The train staion is 10 mins walk from the hotel. Would definitely stay at the Adina again and will use this hotel group again in Europe.
reviews.title: Excellent base for city exploring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel room very well equipped for a small apartment. Very clean with modern decor . Centrally located near the natural history museum . One of the best hotels I stayed in . Breaksfast was buffet type good quality .Get a Berlin Welcome card . free public transport and loads of discount vouchers. Bring your bathing costume it has a heated pool. Nearest underground station is
reviews.title: Enoyed my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Natur Kinder Museum and 50 mins by tube from schoenefeld.
reviews.title: Truly pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern, spacious and clean apartments; knowledgeable and very helpful staff. We had dinner in the restaurants twice; food and service were both outstanding. The hotel is in a good location and you easily get around Berlin. If you have time, check out the hotel's swimming pool and sauna, which are of the highest standard. Perfect stay!
reviews.title: Great hotel near centre of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many others we stayed in this hotel based on the strength of previous reviews. the hotel was about a 35-40 min taxi from schoenefeld airport (40 euros). It's located in a quiet area about a 20 min walk from the Brandenburg gate (or 5 min tube journey).
reviews.title: Location, Service and Quality
